title: Costs of external consequences of cyber attacks on businesses 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Cost in million U.S. dollars for 4 number of Categorys.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
The difference of Cost in million U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Category is 5.4.
min_summary: This bar chart has 4 columns on the x axis representing Category, and Cost in million U.S. dollars in each Category on the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Cost in million U.S. dollars for 4 number of Categorys.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
The difference of Cost in million U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Category is 5.4.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
Second maximum Cost in million U.S. dollars is found at Category Business disruption.
The lowest value at Category Revenue loss is 11.8x times less than the highest value at Information loss.
Category Information loss is higher than any other Categorys with value 5.9, followed by Business disruption, and Equipment damages. Down to Category Revenue loss with the lowest value 0.5.
The highest value 5.9 at Information loss is almost 1.82 times larger than the average value 3.25.
Summing up the values of all Categorys, we get total 13.0.
